text: This is a list of regions of Mali (with 2012 borders) by Human Development Index as of 2018. Note: Gao Region (including the newly created Ménaka Region) and Kidal Region are grouped and have their own HDI. {| class="wikitable sortable" !Rank !Region !HDI (2018) !Comparable countries (2018) |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#fc0;" |Medium human development |- |1 |Bamako |0.602 | |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#900;" |Low human development |- |2 |Koulikoro |0.431 |, |- style="background:#e6e6e6" |– | (average) |0.427 | |- |3 |Sikasso |0.406 | |- |4 |Kayes |0.393 | |- |5 |Gao (with Ménaka) and Kidal |0.386 | |- |6 |Ségou |0.380 | |- |7 |Mopti |0.352 | |- |8 |Tombouctou (with Taoudénit) |0.331 | |} == See also == * List of countries by Human Development Index == References == Mali Mali Human Development Index
title: List of regions of Mali by Human Development Index
